alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Deaf Smith; Donley; Oldham; Palo Duro Canyon; Potter; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued January 10 at 2:26AM CST until January 11 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ENTIRE TEXAS AND OKLAHOMA PANHANDLES... The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Red Flag Warning for strong winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 6 PM CST this evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch for strong winds and low relative humidity is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...In Texas...Oldham...Potter...Carson...Deaf Smith...Randall...Armstrong...Donley and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For Wednesday, west 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For today, southwest winds of 25 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 15 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For Wednesday, RFTI values of 3 to 5 expected. For today, RFTI values of 2 to 3 expected. * Timing...From 11 AM to 8 PM CST on Wednesday. From Noon to 6 PM today.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
